thread.title: Tree downed into power line causes more than 1,500 outages | wtol.com
thread.title_full: Tree downed into power line causes more than 1,500 outages | wtol.com

author: WTOL Newsroom
title: Tree downed into power line causes more than 1,500 outages | wtol.com
text: HOLLAND, Ohio — A tree that fell into a power line on Garden Road in Holland Thursday night knocked out power for more than 1,500 Toledo Edison customers, [according to the utilities company's outage tracker](https://outages-oh.firstenergycorp.com/). Power is estimated to be restored at 11 p.m. Thursday, according to the website. Springfield Township firefighters at the scene on Garden Road just west of I-475 told WTOL 11 that the cause of the felled tree is unclear at this time.
